explanation:
Agent A's report is correct in the sense that the code contains unguarded calls to strlen which can read beyond object bounds. MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash (and MHD_digest_auth_calc_userdigest) call strlen(username) and strlen(realm) without checking that those pointers are non-NULL (or that the buffers are NUL-terminated). If any caller supplies username == NULL or a non-NUL-terminated buffer, strlen will perform out-of-bounds reads (undefined behavior), which violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17.

Note the narrow point: the specific add_new_users function itself passes string literals (which are non-NULL and NUL-terminated), so that particular call chain is safe. However the offending strlen usage is in the exported MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash/userdigest functions, which makes the code base liable to the rule unless every possible caller is proven to satisfy the non-NULL/NUL-terminated preconditions or the functions themselves validate their inputs. Because those validations are not present in the shown code, the report of a Rule 21.17 violation is justified.
